pros:
The staff and physicians are generally nice to work with. 
Management is approachable. 
Overall friendly work environment. 
They offer benefits as opposed to other hospitals in the area that have stopped paying PDO hours like Mission.
cons:
Benefits:
PDO equals to vacation / sick days. 

No paid holidays: if you're scheduled off on one of 6 holidays they dock your PDO account hours.   So essentially you'll lose 6 days of vacation / sick days a year. 

If your weekly hours fall below 40 hours they'll top up your weekly hours to equal 40 with your PDO time . Again losing your few precious hours of vacation / sick time.  So don't plan on getting sick since you won't be able to take full week off until you near the  3rd year.  

There currently is no way to stop or cancel your PDO deductions for holidays or less than 40 hours. 

Also your two legal 15 min breaks are considered a privilege and labeled meditation moments or something. 

All of these PDO topics are considered none employee facing by corporate.  So there will not be any HR paper trail covering this topic in the employee intranet and will be wiped from the HR submission page.   This is only handled by phone calls.

pros: I started here in 2012 and have never regretted that decision. Having moved here from Pennsylvania and not knowing anyone who worked here let alone lived here, I was very anxious when I started. The moment I walked in the door and met my new manager, I knew I was going to be okay. The staff were unbelievably friendly and had such a sense of family that I couldn't help but feel like I was immediately part of the team. I started in the Emergency Department and since then have been given the opportunity to grow in my career so much so that I am now working in a position I have always wanted. The people I work with (and have worked with in my previous positions here) are like my second family. Never have I worked for a company where the CEO will stop you in the hallway to say hello, shake your hand, and ask you how your day is going. The level of patient care/safety is unlike anything I have seen in previous hospitals. Although I no longer work in a patient facing position, I see it everyday with the people I work with and assist. Everyone here cares about the patient, no matter their position.  I can't imagine working anywhere else.
cons: Nothing to complain about here.

pros:
A hospital founded on Christian beliefs which strives to care for the whole patient. Administration attempts to engage employees as partners through numerous communication forums. The annual Park Ridge Experience which is mandatory for all employees, highlights our success and reveals where we need to make improvements, informs us of the overall financial picture and lays out our plans for future growth.  There are periodic town hall meetings, newsletters, emails from the president and individual department staff meetings. Individual employee complements are shared with the entire hospital staff through email. 

Each department is encouraged to have a spiritual ambassador for the support and development of strong interpersonal relationships. There is a creation health coach in each department who keeps the focus on beneficial habits.  Participating in the employee heath program will reduce your immediate healthcare costs and simultaneously facilitate the maintenance of a healthy lifestyle.  Community volunteer projects are encouraged. 

There is an overall sense of camaraderie and team spirit. 

401K with 3% match.
cons: Expensive insurance plan. Flex off for low census (that's the nature of healthcare). Sometimes it seems that money is the first priority.

pros: I love being an employee at AdventHealth Hendersonville. I have worked here for 3 years and am more proud to be an employee every year. I can say that this is definitely the best hospital that I have ever worked in! There is a true feeling that everyone cares about one another and strives to provide the best care to our patients. At previous hospitals I felt like a number. Here I feel like people want to know me and have a genuine interest in my well-being. The entire C-suite is very accessible and engaging with all of the employees. The CNO and CMO have been readily available when I need help or have questions. The entire HR department has been extremely helpful and are always available to answer questions. This even includes the HR Director, who always makes time to help me with different situations. Patient safety is the top priority and that is truly felt here.  I can't wait to see what our hospital does in the future for this community! We have so many new and exciting things happening to continue to help us grow and offer more services to the community.
cons: I can't think of any cons.
